intro: Silene kemahensis, commonly known as the Kemah silene, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its flowers are pink to purple in color and bloom during the late spring to early summer. Silene kemahensis plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
